meanings.definition: A photograph taken with a microscope.
meanings.sent1: I saw tiny microphotographs of cells under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The science book had many microphotographs of bacteria.
meanings.sent3: The microphotographs of insects looked like a tiny world under the lens.
meanings.sent4: Her collection of microphotographs was a window into the unseen.
meanings.sent5: The microphotographs revealed the intricate details of the tiny organisms.

meanings.definition: A photograph reduced in size for reproduction.
meanings.sent1: The artist used microphotographs to create a collage.
meanings.sent2: The magazine included microphotographs of famous landmarks.
meanings.sent3: The microphotographs of landmarks made them look like miniatures.
meanings.sent4: The microphotographs were like shrunken versions of the original images.
meanings.sent5: She used microphotographs to shrink the scenery into small prints.
